INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism of the dopaminergic and the neuroleptics. The dopaminergic can cause or aggravate the psychotic disorders. When a treatment with neuroleptics is necessary for a Parkinsons patient treated with dopaminergics, these latter must be decreased progressively until they are stopped (their abrupt discontinuation exposes the patient to a risk of "neuroleptic malignant syndrome" (NMS)).
